cip.render.raytrace.material.texture

Class AlphaImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.ADynamicNamedObject
      • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.ATexture
        • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.ADualMaterialTexture
          • cip.render.raytrace.material.texture.AlphaImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtMaterial

    public class AlphaImage
extends ADualMaterialTexture
    This is a texture that uses 1 channel of an image as the alpha for mixing two materials

      • getColor

        public void getColor(@NotNull
                     @NotNull RGBf rgb,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull RayIntersection intersection,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtLight[] lights,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtGeometry[] rtObjects,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull IRtBackground rtBkg,
                     int nMaxRecursions,
                     int nSample,
                     int nRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtMaterial
        Compute the colour of a surface as seen from a specific direction.
        Parameters:
        rgb - (modified) The computed colour at the surface.
        intersection - (readonly) The description of the surface - location, orientation, material, etc.
        lights - (readonly) The light in the scene that may affect the intersection.
        rtObjects - (readonly) The objects in the scene.
        rtBkg - (readonly) The background description.
        nMaxRecursions - The maximum reflections to be followed in computing this colour.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
